Flory-Huggins (picmol.models.fh)¶

class picmol.models.fh.FH(smiles: list, phi: array, Smix: array, Hmix: array)[source]¶

Implements the Flory-Huggins thermodynamic model for binary mixtures.

Parameters:

  • smiles (str) – SMILES representation of molecules

  • phi (numpy.ndarray) – volume fraction of solute for Smix and Hmix data

  • Smix (numpy.ndarray) – mixing entropy

  • Hmix (numpy.ndarray) – mixing enthalpy

fit_chi(T)[source]¶

Fits the Flory-Huggins interaction parameter (\(\chi\)) to experimental Gibbs mixing free energy at a given temperature.

Parameters:

T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

fitted \(\chi\) parameter

Return type:

float

vol2mol(phi)[source]¶

Converts volume fraction to mole fraction, where \(V_i\) is molar volume of component i.

\[x = \frac{\phi \left(\frac{V_2}{V_1}\right)}{1 - \phi + \phi \left(\frac{V_2}{V_1}\right)}\]
Parameters:

phi (float) – volume fraction

Returns:

mol fraction

Return type:

float

property phic¶

Volume fraction of solute at critical point

\[\phi_c = \frac{1}{\sqrt{N_1} + \sqrt{N_2}}\]
\[N_i = \frac{V_i}{\min(V)}\]

where \(V_i\) is the molar volume of component i, and \(V\) is a numpy.ndarray containing the molar volumes of all pure components in the mixture.

Returns:

critical volume fraction

Return type:

float

property xc¶

Mol fraction of solute at critical point

Returns:

critical mol fraction

Return type:

float

property chic¶

\(\chi\) parameter at critical point

\[\chi_c = \frac{1}{2} \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{N_1}} + \frac{1}{\sqrt{N_2}} \right)^2\]
Returns:

critical \(\chi\) parameter

Return type:

float

GM(x, T)[source]¶

Calculates the mixing free energy.

\[\Delta G_{mix}^{FH} = RT \left(\frac{\phi \ln{\left(\phi\right)}}{N_1} + \frac{\left(1 - \phi\right) \ln{\left(1 - \phi\right)}}{N_2} \right) + \chi \left(\phi\right) \left(1 - \phi\right)\]
Parameters:

  • x (float or numpy.ndarray) – volume fraction of solute

  • T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

Gibbs mixing free energy

Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray

dGM_dxs(x, T)[source]¶

Calculates the first derivative of Gibbs mixing free energy with respect to composition.

\[\frac{\partial \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}}{\partial \phi_1} = RT \left(\frac{\ln{\left(\phi\right)} + 1}{N_1} - \frac{\ln{\left(1-\phi\right)} + 1}{N_2}\right) + \chi \left(1 - 2\phi \right)\]
Parameters:

  • x (float or numpy.ndarray) – volume fraction of solute

  • T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

first derivative of Gibbs mixing free energy

Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray

det_Hij(x, T)[source]¶

Calculates the determinant of the Hessian of Gibbs mixing free energy, which for a binary system is equivalent to the second derivative of the Gibbs free energy of mixing with respect to composition.

\[\frac{\partial^2 \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}}{\partial \phi_1^2} = RT \left(\frac{1}{\phi N_1} + \frac{1}{\left(1 - \phi\right) N_2}\right) - 2 \chi\]
Parameters:

  • x (float or numpy.ndarray) – volume fraction of solute

  • T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

Hessian of Gibbs mixing free energy

Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray

Fall(x, x0, T)[source]¶

Calculates the mixing free energy of a two-phase binary mixture.

\[x_1, x_2 = x[0], x[1]\]
\[d_0 = \frac{x_0 - x_2}{x_1 - x_2}\]
\[\Delta G_{mix}^{FH} = d_0 \cdot \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}(x_1, T) + (1 - d_0) \cdot \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}(x_2, T)\]

where:

  • \(x_1\) and \(x_2\) are the compositions of the two phases

  • \(x_0\) is the critical composition

  • \(d_0\) is the partition coefficient

  • \(\Delta G_{mix}^{FH}(x, T)\) represents the Gibbs free energy of mixing (GM()) at composition \(x\) and temperature \(T\)

Parameters:

  • x (list or numpy.ndarray) – a list or NumPy array containing the phase compositions [x1, x2]

  • x0 (float) – estimate for the critical composition (\(x_0\))

  • T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

Gibbs mixing free energy for the two-phase mixture

Return type:

float or numpy.ndarray

Jall(x, x0, T)[source]¶

Calculates the Jacobian vector for a two-phase equilibrium calculation.

The Jacobian vector (\(\text{J}\)), representing the derivatives of the phase equilibrium conditions, is calculated as follows:

\[x_1, x_2 = x[0], x[1]\]
\[d_0 = \frac{x_0 - x_2}{x_1 - x_2}\]
\[\begin{split}\begin{aligned} \text{J} = \begin{bmatrix} -\frac{d_0}{x_1 - x_2} \cdot (\Delta G_{mix}^{FH}(x_1, T) - \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}(x_2, T)) + d_0 \cdot \frac{\partial \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}}{\partial \phi}(x_1, T) \\ \frac{1 - d_0}{x_1 - x_2} \cdot (\Delta G_{mix}^{FH}(x_2, T) - \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}(x_1, T)) + (1 - d_0) \cdot \frac{\partial \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}}{\partial \phi}(x_2, T) \end{bmatrix} \end{aligned}\end{split}\]

where:

  • \(x_1\) and \(x_2\) are the compositions of the two phases

  • \(x_0\) is the critical composition

  • \(d_0\) is the partition coefficient

  • \(\Delta G_{mix}^{FH}(x, T)\) represents the Gibbs free energy of mixing (GM()) at composition \(x\) and temperature \(T\)

  • \(\frac{\partial \Delta G_{mix}^{FH}}{\partial \phi}(x, T)\) represents the derivative of the Gibbs free energy of mixing with respect to composition (dGM_dxs()) at \(x\) and \(T\)

Parameters:

  • x (list or numpy.ndarray) – a list or NumPy array containing the phase compositions [x1, x2]

  • x0 (float) – estimate for the critical composition (\(x_0\))

  • T (float) – temperature in Kelvin (K)

Returns:

Jacobian vector, a NumPy array of length 2

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

calculate_spinodals_binodals(x0, T)[source]¶

Calculates spinodal and binodal compositions for a binary mixture.

This function uses numerical methods to determine the spinodal and binodal points of a two-phase system. The spinodal points are found using Brent’s method to find the roots of the determinant of the Hessian matrix. The binodal points are found by minimizing the system’s free energy (Fall()) to its lowest value using the L-BFGS-B algorithm. The Jacobian of Fall (Jall()) is used in the minimization process.

Parameters:

  • x0 (float) – critical composition of the mixture

  • T (float) – temperature (K)

Returns:

A tuple containing the spinodal and binodal compositions: (sp1, sp2, bi1, bi2), where sp1 and sp2 are the spinodal compositions, and bi1 and bi2 are the binodal compositions. All compositions are in mol fraction.

Return type:

tuple(float, float, float, float)
